@nicklcanada I look on the back of my cards. On some it writes CVC2 (Mastercard), on others CVV2 (Visa), and on others nothing. For online payments, the field is named CVV2/CVC2. How about (CVV, CVC, ...)? Agree with (CVV, ...) too. We should change the other projects as well.

@NCAA Thanks, opening a ticket for the team to review.

@dwbit: I realize that the team has discussed this aspect, however, I really think it would be better to use the correct designation here, like:
"Card Verification Value (CVV)" or "CVV (Card Verification Value)".
Also, neither "security", nor "code" is part of the CVV abbreviation mentioned here, so you guys are actually renaming an internationally agreed upon standard designation. I'm not convinced that this approach is a smart one in general.
My advice would be to generally use the internationally agreed upon designations for this security measure (at least for CVV and CVC checksums).
@NCAA Thanks for the additional feedback, I'll add it to the ticket.

The approved Japanese translation "保管庫を検索" lacks the meaning of "my" or "individual." In addition, it is ambiguous whether to search *inside* the storage or search *for* the storage. I suggest "自分の保管庫内を検索."

@olavinto (& @dwbit): The way this is worded, the intended meaning should be "Search in/within an organization", not "Search for an organization". Whether you perform the search related to this organization from within or without that organization, is of no consequence.
When no preposition is used, "in" is implied in this construction.

@NCAA and @olavinto . To me, it isn't that obvious. I dug a little into into the web vault and I believe that it could either be one of these 2 types of search. That's often the problem with translating sentences without the complete context. Anyway, there is a place where a search querry is for finding a specific organization.

@olavinto: Well, then it should read "Search for organization(s)" or "Find organization(s)". You "Search for X" when you haven't found the object, you "Search X" when you already have/know that object.
But again, I've seen this exact phrase used for both meanings, so the actual context will be the determining factor in the final output.

@NCAA @olavinto There's one really big problem when translating out of precise context; it's totally impossible not to make mistakes that could potentially mislead users. I like doing it, but I really hope that someday it will be possible to do it in a simulated environment that shows visuals as if it was used as normal. So, in the mid-time or maybe until end of the world, I'm doing my best and let it go as I will do for this one!
@jseb.mercier This is greyed out text that appears in the sidebar after you have tapped on an organization in the sidebar.
@dwbit yeah. Would be great...

This placeholder text changes according to what is currently selected from a vault's sidebar. Actually most search strings appear this way in the UI and there really isn't any special dedicated search buttons or pages. Search is more about filtering in this project and these strings almost always mean "Search (in the currently selected/open list) vault/item type/collection/folder/members...". They should also be kept relatively short so that they fit in the sidebar and the search field. There are a few exceptions and those are formed differently to begin with.
@olavinto: Thx for the update... :-)
@olavinto Thanks for the feedback, we are aiming to reduce the number of projects this year from 4 down to either 2 or 1 and I will look at the possibility of screenshots.
@jseb.mercier 👍
@olavinto Great idea, I'll look into this one.

The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir supprimer cette pièce jointe ?" In the French grammar, we use the masculine grammatical, the correct translation is: « Êtes-vous sûr »
@Flamare Hi there! 👋 Thanks for contributing! I'd rather stick with the inclusive writing since it doesn't hurt to make people more welcome to use the product 😊

Hi @Crocmagnon ! 🙋‍♀️🙂 Thanks! I do not agree with your militant conception of language. I am a woman, feminist, for the inclusion of all, and against this "epicene language" which is a regression. You can read: https://fr.sputniknews.com/france/202102161045232209-vers-une-interdiction-de-lecriture-inclusive-elle-est-en-realite-totalement-excluante/
Even if your militant ideology is only visible on a very small part of the application. it's a matter of principle. Or, I respect your conception, but in this case: Bitwarden must offer two translations, an "French epicene" for radical militants. and a "French" for all those who do not share your militant conception.
Thank you

@Flamare thanks for explaining your point of view!
I’ll think about it and do some more research before taking a decision 👍

@Flamare After doing some research and thinking more about it, I came to the conclusion that we should indeed use the grammatical masculine. * I personally don't have strong convictions on the subject so I'm not ready to fight about it (and I have other topics I need to spend my energy on). * I personally find the epicene writing harder to read, especially for convoluted constructions * It's harder to maintain * At least one other person is ready to fight against (that'd be you 😉)
And the argument that really clicked with me: It could prevent some users to use the software properly because it would make it harder for them to understand the messages. I'm thinking of visually impaired people who use a screen reader or people affected with dys- troubles like dyslexia.
@Flamare Thanks again for your contribution!
@Flamare I just combed over all the files to search for occurrences of "·" "⋅" "•" and "(e)", I shouldn't have forgotten any. If you want to double check you're more than welcome :)

Thank you very much for your research and your conclusions @Crocmagnon I think your arguments are very relevant, on people with dyslexia or with screen reading systems, and an difficult and unpronounceable writing.
Thank you for your openness, that you took the time to think about it ! 🙏🙂
I checked, everything is good !

duoOrganizationDesc
'Duo Security' and 'Duo Mobile' are product names and should not be translated.

trans-unit.note: The current approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Authentifier votre organisation avec Duo Security à l'aide de l'application Duo Mobile, un SMS, un appel téléphonique, ou une clé de sécurité U2F."
@Deaudouce In this case we're more "securing the organization with Duo" rather than "authenticating the organization". So I'd stick with the current translation. What do you think?
@Crocmagnon It doesn't take into account the "Verify/S'authentifier" meaning. Maybe something like "S'authentifier avec Duo Security en tant que/avec votre organisation" ?

@Deaudouce This string is used in the enterprise organization settings page for 2FA. It's not used to authenticate the organization itself or to authenticate as the organization but rather used to secure the organization by enabling 2FA for all of its users. Therefore I'd prefer keeping "sécurisez votre organisation".

trans-unit.source: Use any FIDO U2F compatible security key to access your account.
trans-unit.target: Använd en FIDO U2F-kompatibel säkerhetsnyckel för att komma åt ditt konto.

trans-unit.note: @kspearrin: "…security a key" is supposed to indicate/mean what exactly?
what does "a key" mean here?

I don't think "suojausavain" is the correct word to use for translating "passkey".
That's what the physical security devices like YubiKeys and Titan Security Keys are called. All the big companies like Google, Microsoft and Apple use that word for them.
Better words for "passkey" would be "avainkoodi", which is what Google calls them, or "todentamisavain", which is the word Microsoft, Apple and others use.
Bitwarden web app → Settings → Security → Two-step login, Formerly "FIDO2 WebAuthn" now changes to "Passkey"

trans-unit.source: Use your device's biometrics or a FIDO2 compatible security key.
trans-unit.target: Använd enhetens biometri eller en FIDO2-kompatibel säkerhetsnyckel.

The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Alegeți un dosar în care doriți să mutați $COUNT$ articole selectate." It is not necessary to use plural termination between parentheses. Usually in Romanian, when generalizing, only the plural is used even if there is only one element (Ex. "1 minute", "1 ore"). For maximum correctness, the singular for 1 (1 minut"), the simple plural from 2 to 19 ("12 minute") and the compound plural from 20 to 100 ("99 de minute") should be used, then repeat from 101 (complicated, right?).
Finnish would also like to have spearate plural form.
Plural form please.
+1 for a separate plural string

trans-unit.target: Ingen uppdateringstoken eller API-nyckel hittades. Försök att logga ut och logga in igen.

trans-unit.source: This export contains your vault data in an unencrypted format. You should not store or send the exported file over unsecure channels (such as email). Delete it immediately after you are done using it.
trans-unit.target: Denna export innehåller ditt valv i ett okrypterat format. Du bör inte lagra eller skicka den exporterade filen över osäkra kanaler (t.ex. e-post). Radera den omedelbart när du är färdig med den.
trans-unit.note: mejor caja fuerte en vez de bóveda ¿no?

Bitwarden allows to export vault data using csv or json, so translation shouldn't contain "csv". I've changed it as the follow: "本次导出会将你的数据存为未经加密的文件。你不应该长期保存，或者通过不加密的方式传送这个文件（例如电子邮件）。请在使用完之后立即删除这个文件。"

trans-unit.source: This export contains your secrets data in an unencrypted format. You should not store or send the exported file over unsecure channels (such as email). Delete it immediately after you are done using it.
trans-unit.target: Denna export innehåller ditt valv i ett okrypterat format. Du bör inte lagra eller skicka den exporterade filen över osäkra kanaler (t.ex. e-post). Radera den omedelbart när du är färdig med den.
trans-unit.note: "Export" is more of an Anglicism than a true French word. It is sometimes used as a diminutive form of "exportation", but it remains a lesser choice.

trans-unit.source: This export encrypts your data using your account's encryption key. If you ever rotate your account's encryption key you should export again since you will not be able to decrypt this export file.
trans-unit.target: Denna export krypterar dina data med kontots krypteringsnyckel. Om du någonsin roterar kontots krypteringsnyckel bör du exportera igen eftersom du inte kommer att kunna dekryptera denna exportfil.
trans-unit.note: The currently approved translation is not correct. Please review my suggestion: "Ez az exportálás titkosítja az adatokat a fiók titkosítási kulcsával. Ha a fiók titkosítási kulcsa változik akkor újra exportálni kell mindent, mert utána nem lehet visszafejteni a régi exportált fájlokat."

trans-unit.source: Account encryption keys are unique to each Bitwarden user account, so you can't import an encrypted export into a different account.
trans-unit.target: Kypteringsnycklar är unika för varje Bitwarden-konto, så du kan inte importera en krypterad export till ett annat konto.

trans-unit.note: Is this a verb or a noun?
@grb This one is a verb

trans-unit.source: This file export will be password protected and require the file password to decrypt.
trans-unit.target: Den exporterade filen kommer vara lösenordsskyddad. Du kommer behöva ange fillösenordet för att dekryptera den.

trans-unit.source: This password will be used to export and import this file
trans-unit.target: Detta lösenord kommer att användas för att exportera och importera denna fil

trans-unit.note: Shouldn't this be "Confirm export"?

trans-unit.source: Use your account encryption key, derived from your account's username and Master Password, to encrypt the export and restrict import to only the current Bitwarden account.
trans-unit.target: Använd ditt kontos krypteringsnyckel, som härrör från ditt kontos användarnamn och huvudlösenord, för att kryptera exporten och begränsa importen till endast det aktuella Bitwarden-kontot.
trans-unit.note: The currently approved translation is not correct. Please review my suggestion: "A fiók titkosítókulcsának használata, melyet a felhasználói azonosítódból és a mesterjelszavadból képezünk és a mentett állomány ezzel kerül titkosításra, így az csak a jelenlegi Bitwarden fiókba lesz betölthető."

trans-unit.source: Set a file password to encrypt the export and import it to any Bitwarden account using the password for decryption.
trans-unit.target: Välj ett fillösenord för att kryptera exportfilen. Filen kan sedan importeras till valfritt Bitwarden-konto med hjälp av fillösenordet.

Refer to the string with the 'accountRestrictedOptionDescription' key, which reads as follows:
"Use your account encryption key, derived from your account's username and Master Password, to encrypt the export and restrict import to only the current Bitwarden account."
So "Account restricted" means the export is restricted to your account only.

trans-unit.source: Proceeding will change your account email address. It will not change the email address used for two-step login authentication. You can change this email address in the two-step login settings.
trans-unit.target: Fortsätter du så kommer din e-postadress att ändras för ditt konto. Det kommer inte att ändra e-postadressen som används för tvåfaktorsautentisering. Du kan ändra denna e-postadress i inställningarna för tvåstegsverifiering.

trans-unit.source: Proceeding will log you out of your current session, requiring you to log back in. Active sessions on other devices may continue to remain active for up to one hour.
trans-unit.target: Om du fortsätter kommer du loggas ut från sin nuvarande session vilket kräver att du loggar in igen. Aktiva sessioner på andra enheter kan fortsätta vara aktiva i upp till en timme.
trans-unit.note: Reminder: "continue to remain". French localization adapted without the redundancy, waiting for the source string to be updated.

trans-unit.source: After changing your password, you will need to log in with your new password. Active sessions on other devices will be logged out within one hour.
trans-unit.target: När du har ändrat ditt lösenord måste du logga in med ditt nya lösenord. Aktiva sessioner på andra enheter kommer att loggas ut inom en timme.

trans-unit.source: Please log back in. If you are using other Bitwarden applications log out and back in to those as well.
trans-unit.target: Vänligen logga in igen. Om du använder andra Bitwarden-applikationer, logga ut och in igen i dem också.

KDF Algorithm https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_derivation_function
KDF Iterations https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PBKDF2

trans-unit.source: Higher KDF iterations can help protect your master password from being brute forced by an attacker. We recommend a value of $VALUE$ or more.
trans-unit.target: Högre KDF-iterationer kan skydda ditt huvudlösenord från att knäckas av en angripare via "brute forcing". Vi rekommenderar ett värde på $VALUE$ eller mer.

context-group.context:
kdfIterationsDesc
A sample value for the variable $value$: 100,000

trans-unit.note: The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Numărul mai mare de iterații KDF poate ajuta la protejarea parolei principale de un atac prin forță brută. Vă recomandăm valoarea de $VALUE$ sau mai mare."

trans-unit.source: Setting your KDF iterations too high could result in poor performance when logging into (and unlocking) Bitwarden on slower or older devices. We recommend that you increase the value in increments of $INCREMENT$ and then test all of your devices.
trans-unit.target: Att ställa in dina KDF-iterationer för högt kan resultera i dålig prestanda när du loggar in (och låser upp) Bitwarden på enheter med långsammare processorer. Vi rekommenderar att du ökar värdet i steg om $INCREMENT$ och sedan testar alla dina enheter.

context-group.context:
kdfIterationsWarning
A sample value for the variable $increment$: 50,000

trans-unit.note:
The current approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Wenn Sie die Anzahl der KDF-Iterationen zu hoch setzen, kann es sein, dass das Einloggen in (und Entsperren von) Bitwarden auf langsameren Geräten länger dauert. Wir empfehlen, dass Sie den Wert wiederholt um $INCREMENT$ anheben und auf all Ihren Geräten testen."
The current translation contains several typos ("Schrittweise", "anhebest") and is using "du" instead of the more common "Sie". The translation by mqus has "ihren Geräten" instead of "Ihren".

The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Ak nastavíte KDF iterácie príliš vysoko, môže to viesť k zníženému výkonu pri prihlasovaní do Bitwardenu (a pri jeho odomykaní) na zariadeniach s pomalšimi procesormi. Odporúčame navyšovať túto hodnotu po $INCREMENT$ inkrementoch a následne otestovať na všetkých vašich zariadeniach."

context-group.context:
kdfMemory
Memory refers to computer memory (RAM). MB is short for megabytes.

trans-unit.source: Setting your KDF iterations, memory, and parallelism too high could result in poor performance when logging into (and unlocking) Bitwarden on slower or older devices. We recommend changing these individually in small increments and then test all of your devices.
trans-unit.target: Att ställa in dina KDF-iterationer, minne och parallellism för högt kan resultera i dålig prestanda när du loggar in (och låser upp) Bitwarden på långsammare eller äldre enheter. Vi rekommenderar att du ändrar dessa individuellt i små steg och sedan testar alla dina enheter.

trans-unit.source: Higher KDF iterations, memory, and parallelism can help protect your master password from being brute forced by an attacker.
trans-unit.target: Högre KDF-iterationer, minne och parallellism kan hjälpa till att skydda ditt huvudlösenord från att bli brutalt tvingad av en angripare.

trans-unit.note: would it be correct if translation meant "change kdf settings" ?
@Crocmagnon It could go either way. The section is titled "Encryption Key Settings", however.
KDF = Key derivation function https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_derivation_function
The current approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Desautorizar sessões"

trans-unit.source: Concerned your account is logged in on another device? Proceed below to deauthorize all computers or devices that you have previously used. This security step is recommended if you previously used a public computer or accidentally saved your password on a device that isn't yours. This step will also clear all previously remembered two-step login sessions.
trans-unit.target: Orolig att ditt konto är inloggat på en annan enhet? Fortsätt nedan för att avauktorisera alla datorer eller enheter som du har använt tidigare. Detta rekommenderas om du har använt en offentlig dator eller av misstag sparat ditt lösenord på en enhet som inte är din. Detta steg kommer också att rensa alla tidigare ihågkomna sessioner med tvåstegsverifiering.
trans-unit.note: The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Vă îngrijorează faptul că contul dvs. este folosit pe un alt dispozitiv? Utilizați opțiunea de mai jos pentru a revoca autorizarea altor computere sau dispozitive pe care v-ați conectat anterior. Acest procedeu este recomandat dacă ați folosit anterior un computer public sau ați salvat din greșeală parola pe un dispozitiv care nu este al dvs. Acesta va elimina, de asemenea, orice autentificare în două etape stocată anterior."

The currently approved translation is not correct. Please review my suggestion: "Bist du besorgt, dass dein Konto auf einem anderen Gerät angemeldet ist? Fahre unten fort, um dich von alle Computern oder Geräten, die du zuvor verwendet hast, abzumelden. Dieser Sicherheitsschritt wird empfohlen, wenn du zuvor einen öffentlichen Computer verwendet oder dein Passwort versehentlich auf einem Gerät gespeichert hast, das dir nicht gehört. Dieser Schritt löscht auch alle zuvor gespeicherten zweistufigen Anmeldesitzungen."

The currently approved translation is not correct. Please review my suggestion: "Aggódsz egy másik eszközön történő bejelentkezés miatt? Itt tudod érvényteleníteni az összes bejelentekezett számítógépet vagy mobil eszközt amit korábban használtál. Ez a biztonsági lépés akkor ajánlott, ha korábban nyilvános helyen levő számítógépet használtál vagy véletlenül mentettél jelszót egy olyan eszközön, amely nem a sajátod. Ez a lépés törli az összes korábban megjegyzett kétfaktoros bejelentkezési munkamenetet."

trans-unit.source: Proceeding will also log you out of your current session, requiring you to log back in. You will also be prompted for two-step login again, if set up. Active sessions on other devices may continue to remain active for up to one hour.
trans-unit.target: Om du fortsätter kommer du loggas ut från sin nuvarande session vilket kräver att du loggar in igen. Du kommer även behöva verifiera med tvåstegsverifiering om det är aktiverat. Aktiva sessioner på andra enheter kan fortsätta vara aktiva i upp till en timme.
trans-unit.note: The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Continuând, veți fi deconectat de asemenea de la sesiunea curentă, solicitându-vă să vă reconectați. De asemenea, vi se va solicita din nou autentificarea în două etape, dacă este activată. Sesiunile active pe alte dispozitive pot continua să rămână active timp de până la o oră."

trans-unit.source: With new device login protection turned off, anyone with your master password can access your account from any device. To protect your account without verification emails, set up two-step login.

trans-unit.note: Very much doubt that this will make sense in all languages…

@NCAA Yeah, I agree. In Finnish, for example, this requires changing the word order. For this reason I have used only a dot . for this string and moved "instead" to the first part of the sentence. According to the context information that should not be a problem since this part is just a part of a plain text sentence with two possible endings which both use the "instead" part anyway (unless some context info is missing).
Still, breaking down sentences generally makes things difficult (more or less). The reason here is the "new item" link that is between the parts.
@olavinto I created a thread for this general problem 2 weeks ago: https://community.bitwarden.com/t/stop-splitting-longer-sentences-into-multiple-strings/63382
@kennymc-c Cool, than you.

The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Показывать значки сайтов" Кроме веб-сайтов бывают ещё какие-нибудь сайты? Нет. Поэтому добавлять "веб-" не нужно. Это требуется только в английском, где у слова site могут быть разные значения.

Это не ошибка, просто замечание на будущее. Ответ тут простой: следовать логике. Но, конечно, ссылаться на то, что активно используется в речи, а что неактивно, нельзя. Сегодня грамотность в массе аховая, активно используют всякое безобразие, например "рандомно" или "фоловеры". Но это же не причина, чтобы и нам так поступать, правильно? Кроме того, слово "сайт" просто короче, а чем слова короче, тем легче переводчику. :)

De exemplu, introduceți "google.com" în loc de "www.google.com". Puteți introduce de asemenea "androidapp://package.name" pentru a asocia o aplicație Android cu alte domenii de saituri web."
Has to be "Du" instead "Sie"
@clausstern Hey Claus, thanks for letting us know, can you add the corrected string and then ping me again once that is done?

@dwbit: What this actually reads is the equivalent of "Enter a list of domain names and separate this list by commas.", which isn't the intended meaning (and also makes no sense).
Instead, this text should read, e.g., "Create a list containing domain names separated by commas. ..." or "Create a list by entering domain names separated by commas. ...".
Also, it's "...Android app...", not (never!) "...android app...":
>> "Create a list by entering domains separated by commas. Only "base" domains are allowed, not subdomains. For example, enter "google.com" instead of "www.google.com". You can also enter "androidapp://package.name" to associate an Android app with other website domains." / "Create a list by entering domains separated by commas. Domains only are allowed, no subdomains (e.g., "google.com", but not "www.google.com"). You can also enter "androidapp://package.name" to associate an Android app with other website domains.".
@NCAA Thanks, reviewing with the team!
As alredy mentioned in another comment, Android should be always wrote with a capital "A".

trans-unit.source: Setting up two-step login can permanently lock you out of your Bitwarden account. A recovery code allows you to access your account in the event that you can no longer use your normal two-step login provider (example: you lose your device). Bitwarden support will not be able to assist you if you lose access to your account. We recommend you write down or print the recovery code and keep it in a safe place.
trans-unit.target: Att aktivera tvåstegsverifiering kan låsa ute dig från ditt Bitwarden-konto permanent. En återställningskod låter dig komma åt ditt konto om du inte längre kan använda din vanliga metod för tvåstegsverifiering (t.ex. om du förlorar din enhet). Bitwardens kundservice kommer inte att kunna hjälpa dig om du förlorar åtkomst till ditt konto. Vi rekommenderar att du skriver ner eller skriver ut återställningskoden och förvarar den på ett säkert ställe.
trans-unit.note: The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Activarea autentificării în două etape vă poate bloca definitiv contul Bitwarden. Un cod de recuperare vă permite să vă accesați contul când nu mai puteți utiliza furnizorul dvs. normal de autentificare în două etape (ex. vă pierdeți dispozitivul). Asistența Bitwarden nu vă va putea ajuta dacă pierdeți accesul la contul dvs. Vă recomandăm să notați sau să imprimați codul de recuperare și să îl păstrați într-un loc sigur."

The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation (changed "verlieren" to "verlierst"): "Durch die Aktivierung der Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierung kannst du dich dauerhaft aus deinem Bitwarden-Konto aussperren. Ein Wiederherstellungscode ermöglicht es dir, auf dein Konto zuzugreifen, falls du deinen normalen Zwei-Faktor-Anbieter nicht mehr verwenden kannst (z.B. wenn du dein Gerät verlierst). Der Bitwarden-Support kann dir nicht helfen, wenn du den Zugang zu deinem Konto verlierst. Wir empfehlen dir, den Wiederherstellungscode aufzuschreiben oder auszudrucken und an einem sicheren Ort aufzubewahren."

trans-unit.source: URLs that start with http:// don’t use the best available encryption. Change the login URIs for these accounts to https:// for safer browsing.
trans-unit.target: Att använda osäkra webbplatser med http://-protokollet kan vara farligt. Om webbplatsen stödjer det, bör du alltid ansluta med https://-protokollet så att anslutningen är krypterad.
trans-unit.note: @NCAA Thanks, I'll pass this one along.

The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Gli indirizzi che cominciano con http:// non usano la migliore criptografia disponibile. Modifica gli URI di accesso per questi account usando https:// per una navigazione più sicura."

@FaviFake Same here

Yeah, also problamatic for Finnish. These should have different plural forms. Doing things this way simply doesn't work for localization because many languages handle plurals very differently and require more changes than just a single word behind a variable.

trans-unit.note: Unless I'm missing out on something important, then Bitwarden currently has no way to detect if 2FA has been turned on for a website or not. Therefore I personally find it to be a bit too assuming to assume that the report's entries are "inactive" or "without 2FA".

@DandelionSprout I agree and have translated this basically as "2FA status of logins". Since this is a report header and the report comes with bunch of summary text, it really does not matter. Shorter length was also a reason for me to use 2FA instead of the complete written translation which would have been "kaksivaineisen kirjautumisen". Several lines long header wouldn't looked good on the sidebar (formerly) or on the box on the reports page (currently).
@dwbit This could use a screenshot as could other report headers too. Or possibly a max length suggestion in the context.
@olavinto Thanks for the feedback Oskari!
@olavinto Thanks for the feedback, I'll see what I can do.

trans-unit.source: Two-step login adds a layer of protection to your accounts. Set up two-step login using Bitwarden authenticator for these accounts or use an alternative method.
trans-unit.target: Tvåstegsverifiering (2FA) är en viktig säkerhetsinställning som hjälper dig att säkra dina konton. Om en webbplats erbjuder det bör du alltid aktivera tvåstegsverifiering.
trans-unit.note: Они сами путаются в терминах –двухфакторная аутентификация или двухэтапная. Нужно разобраться и везде использовать правильный термин, а не так, как сейчас.
@erodim для основателя проекта английский не является родным языком:)

trans-unit.target: Vi hittade $COUNT$ webbplats(er) i din $VAULT$ som kanske inte är konfigurerade med tvåstegsinloggning (enligt 2fa.directory). För att ytterligare skydda dessa konton bör du konfigurera tvåstegsinloggning.

trans-unit.note: I'm going to discard the VAULTS variable ompoletely because if it were plural the entire sentence would be grammatically incorrect

These should have different plural forms. Doing things this way simply doesn't work for localization because many languages handle plurals very differently and require more changes than just a single word behind a variable.

If $VAULT$ string is used in the translation it shows as "vault" (English) on the website even though the actual "vault" string is translated. Where is this "vault" which gets inserted here coming from? Why is a variable $VAULT$ used here instead of the word "vault" which can be translated?

trans-unit.source: No websites were found in your vault with a missing two-step login configuration.
trans-unit.target: Inga webbplatser utan tvåstegsverifiering hittades i ditt valv.
trans-unit.note: twofactorauth.org currently refuses to list e.g. forums (such as Bitwarden's forum) and unpopular websites (such as NotABug.org). So I feel that it deserves to be hinted at that there may still be accounts that supports 2FA despite not being listed in the report.
Instead of "websites" I recommend using "logins" because that has been used in most other strings related to this. It would also be more fitting since the logins are used in apps too.
@olavinto Thanks Oskari, I'll open a ticket for this one.

@dwbit: If this doesn't refer to passwords at high risk of being broken/cracked but instead refers to already cracked ones, then this should read "Compromised passwords" instead.
"compromised", in this context, refers to passwords that have already been cracked, broken, posted publicly (including closed forums), etc. "exposed", in this context, refers to passwords with a higher risk of getting compromised due to having a weak composition or low complexity, insufficient length, etc.
@NCAA Thanks, I'll review this one with the team!
@NCAA 👍 (replying to close out notification).

trans-unit.note: @dwbit: Again, "Compromised..." is probably the better choice.

context-group.context:
accountCredit
Financial term. In the case of Bitwarden, a positive balance means that you owe money, while a negative balance means that you have a credit (Bitwarden owes you money).

accountBalance
Financial term. In the case of Bitwarden, a positive balance means that you owe money, while a negative balance means that you have a credit (Bitwarden owes you money).

addCredit
Add more credit to your account's balance.

trans-unit.source: Your payment method will be charged for any unpaid subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Din betalningsmetod kommer att debiteras för eventuella obetalda prenumerationer.

trans-unit.source: Your plan comes with a free 7 day trial. Your payment method will not be charged until the trial has ended. You may cancel at any time.
trans-unit.target: Din plan kommer med en kostnadsfri 7-dagars provperiod. Din betalningsmetod kommer inte att debiteras förrän provperioden har upphört. Du kan avbryta när som helst.
trans-unit.note: "Your card will not be charged until the trial has ended and on a recurring basis each $INTERVAL$" should be clarified. I am not sure what was intended to express here.
I updated the source string here. Hopefully it is more clear now. It was a bit confusing in English too.

I think "Testversion" is a poor translation of "trial" in this context. "Testversion" = "test version" works kind of for first sentence (i.e. "7 day test version") but not second sentence: "You will not be charged until trail version ends" would also be confusing in English, e.g. what's the difference between the real and test version. Better to us "test time" or "trial time". Hence I suggest the use of "Probezeit": "Ihr Abo startet mit einer kostenlose Probezeit von 7 Tagen. Ihre Karte wird nicht belastet, bis die Probezeit abgelaufen ist. Die Rechnung kommt wiederkehrend jeden/jedes $INTERVAL$. Sie können jederzeit kündigen."
Thanks Stephan! I think you are correct and adjusted the text accordingly.

trans-unit.source: Your payment method will not be charged during the 7 day free trial.
trans-unit.target: Du kommer inte att debiteras under din 7-dagars gratis provperiod.
trans-unit.note:
You don't "charge a payment method":
>> "Payment is not charged via the selected payment method during the 7-day free trial period.".

@NCAA In theory, you can charge a payment method too. For example, a credit card can be charged without any action from its owner (if they have enabled automatic renewal) and there are even payment methods that are not linked to any individual in any direct way (like cryptocurrencies for example so you have to charge the payment method instead of an entity). You can also charge (or bill) an entity too that will then make the payment. Still, your suggestion is better.

@olavinto: Yup, right you are, however, this explicitly pertains to a payment being charged (or rather not being charged in this case) using the payment method registered by the user in the context of commencing the trial period (an approach used by many companies in many contexts today).
To specify, a "payment method" is not something you charge, you actually charge the associated means of payment, or in other words, the account of your bank, financial institution, etc., from where the funds are transferred upon payment execution.
That's why I suggest amending to "Payment is not charged via the selected payment method...", or you could also say "Payment is not charged to your account...".
"charging a method", regardless of what that method might be, just isn't an option.
@NCAA Thanks for the feedback everyone! Correcting these source strings may take a little time as we look at moving from 4 separate translation projects into 1.
@NCAA This reply will mark this discussion as completed 👍 (please only reply to this if you have additional information as it will open the discussion again.
The current approved translation is not correct, please review my translation: "Cartão de crédito"
@dwbit: Would be more appropriate to use "Payment card" here, unless only the credit card type can be used.
@NCAA This one is from the billing screen that allows you to pick from credit card, bank account and paypal, so should be fine as such.

@dwbit: My overall point is that "Payment card" should be the preferred designation instead of "debit/credit card" as this covers both alternatives.
From a communications angle, you could say that only mentioning one of the two types, automatically rules out the use of the one not mentioned. This reservation is non-existent for "Payment card".
@NCAA Thanks, I have a queue of pending items with the team for review.

trans-unit.note:
For other translators, the full sentence reads:
"If you want to add additional seats without the bundled offer, please contact"
In Hebrew, the translation of "additional seats" places "seats" before "additional". So it is not a good practice to split a sentence like this..

trans-unit.source: seats without the bundled offer, please contact
trans-unit.target: platser utan det samlade erbjudandet, vänligen kontakta
trans-unit.note: This ends kind of abruptly... or not? Is there something supposed to be appended at the end of this? Like an e-mail address or something else? It matters for translation.

+1. Indeed, it really does matter. For some reason Bitwarden has started to move towards being less localization friendly than it used to be. Recently there has been several additions during the last year or so where sentences are broken into parts and situations where a using variable for some value (like an email address) would make things much easier, and even more importantly, would allow more fluent and natural translations. Not good, not good at all. :(
In this string it would help a lot if the part that follows "contact" was a variable that we could move to where ever we want in the sentence. Since it is now last, we are forced to find some less fluent ways to present this. Again, not good! It's still far from being the worst or even bad, but not a good direction.

The real text is combined out of these parts:
smStandaloneTrialSeatCountUpdateMessageFragment1 + passwordManager + smStandaloneTrialSeatCountUpdateMessageFragment2 + contactSupportShort
Still, I agree that it should contain variables, not be split like that.

trans-unit.source: After updating your encryption key, you are required to log out and back in to all Bitwarden applications that you are currently using (such as the mobile app or browser extensions). Failure to log out and back in (which downloads your new encryption key) may result in data corruption. We will attempt to log you out automatically, however, it may be delayed.
trans-unit.target: Efter att ha uppdaterat din krypteringsnyckel, måste du logga ut och in igen i alla Bitwarden-program som du använder (t.ex. mobilappen och webbläsartillägget). Att inte logga ut och in igen (vilket hämtar din nya krypteringsnyckel) kan resultera i datakorruption. Vi kommer försöka logga ut dig automatiskt, men det kan vara fördröjt.

What is "Bitwarden CLI" ? CLI = command-line interface Bitwarden provides a powerful, full-featured command-line interface (CLI) tool for accessing and managing your Bitwarden vault. All features that you find in other Bitwarden client applications (Desktop, Browser Extension, etc.) are also available through the CLI.
The CLI can be used cross-platform on Windows, macOS, and Linux distributions. https://bitwarden.com/help/article/cli/

Нельзя в одном и том же документе использовать разные термины для обозначения одного и того же объекта. Поэтому пишем либо "учётные записи", либо "аккаунты". Конечно, "учётные записи" лучше, так как по-русски, но слово "аккаунт" уже утвердилось, и, кроме того, оно короче, что немаловажно при локализации ПО, особенно для мобильных устройств. Поэтому предлагаю везде (за исключением банковских дел) писать "аккаунт". И не забывайте, пожалуйста, про букву "ё" – она полноправно присутствует в русском алфавите, никаких причин её избегать нет.
@erodim использование буквы ё факультативно. Не используйте, пожалуйста, поучительный тон в общении с коллегами-переводчиками.
Андрей, пожалуйста, см. личные сообщения.

trans-unit.note:
What is "Single Organization"
Is one of Bitwarden Enterprise policy. Enabling the Single Organization policy will restrict non-Owner/non-Admin members of your Organization from being able to join other Organizations, or from creating other Organizations. https://bitwarden.com/help/article/policies/#single-organization
Enterprise Policies: 1. Two-Step Login 2. Master Password 3. Password Generator 4. Single Organization 5. Single Sign-On Authentication https://bitwarden.com/help/article/policies/

trans-unit.source: Restrict members from joining other organizations.
trans-unit.target: Hindra användare från att gå med i några andra organisationer.

trans-unit.source: Restrict members from joining other organizations. This policy is required for organizations that have enabled domain verification.
trans-unit.target: Begränsa medlemmar från att gå med i andra organisationer. Den här principen krävs för organisationer som har aktiverat domänverifiering.

trans-unit.source: Your current organization has a policy that does not allow you to join more than one organization. Please contact your organization admins or sign up from a different Bitwarden account.
trans-unit.target: Din nuvarande organisation har en policy som hindrar dig från att gå med i fler än en organisation. Vänligen kontakta din organisations administratörer eller registrera ett annat Bitwarden-konto.
trans-unit.note: I think that `sign up` should be replaced with `sign in`, as one does not have to sign up (register / create a new account) if they already have it.

@tukusejssirs I guess it is meant to say "sign up" as of "register with" different Bitwarden account. Probably this is an error during joining of new organisation.
I could be wrong though.

@laurisade, I understand what it means _currently_, however, one could already have registered a different account (e.g. private in contrary to a work account), however, the user would just forgot to switch them or used the other one by mistake. That’s why I suggest to replace sign up / register with sign in / log in. ;)

trans-unit.source: Development, DevOps, and IT teams choose Bitwarden Secrets Manager to securely manage and deploy their infrastructure and machine secrets.
trans-unit.target: Utvecklings-, DevOps- och IT-team väljer Bitwarden Secrets Manager för att på ett säkert sätt hantera och distribuera sin infrastruktur och sina maskinhemligheter.

trans-unit.source: Securely store and manage secrets in one location to prevent secret sprawl across your organization.
trans-unit.target: Lagra och hantera hemligheter på ett säkert sätt på en och samma plats för att förhindra att hemligheter sprids i organisationen.

trans-unit.source: Protect secrets with end-to-end encryption. No more hard coding secrets or sharing through .env files.
trans-unit.target: Skydda hemligheter med end-to-end-kryptering. Inget mer hårdkodande av hemligheter eller delning via .env-filer.
trans-unit.note: 当前批准的译文有误，请审阅我的译文： “使用端到端加密保护密码。而不再需要硬编码密码或通过 .env 文件分享密码。”

trans-unit.source: Programmatically retrieve and deploy secrets at runtime so developers can focus on what matters most, like improving code quality.
trans-unit.target: Hämta och distribuera hemligheter programmatiskt vid körning så att utvecklare kan fokusera på det som är viktigast, som att förbättra kodkvaliteten.

trans-unit.source: Maintain tight control over machine and human access to secrets with SSO integrations, event logs, and access rotation.
trans-unit.target: Håll noggrann kontroll över maskinell och mänsklig åtkomst till hemligheter med SSO-integreringar, händelseloggar och åtkomstrotation.

trans-unit.source:
Hi,
I am requesting a subscription to Bitwarden Secrets Manager for our team. Your support would mean a great deal!
Bitwarden Secrets Manager is an end-to-end encrypted secrets management solution for securely storing, sharing, and deploying machine credentials like API keys, database passwords, and authentication certificates.
Secrets Manager will help us to:
- Improve security - Streamline operations - Prevent costly secret leaks
To request a free trial for our team, please reach out to Bitwarden.
Thank you for your help!
trans-unit.target:
Hej,
Jag vill prenumerera på Bitwarden Secrets Manager för vårt team. Er hjälp skulle betyda mycket för oss!
Bitwarden Secrets Manager är en helt krypterad lösning för hantering av hemlig information som gör det möjligt att säkert lagra, dela och distribuera maskinuppgifter som API-nycklar, databaslösenord och autentiseringscertifikat.
Secrets Manager hjälper oss att:
- förbättra säkerheten - effektivisera verksamheten - förhindra kostsamma läckor av hemlig information.
För att begära en kostnadsfri testversion för vårt team, vänligen kontakta Bitwarden.
Tack för er hjälp!
trans-unit.note:
This appears extremely messy!
First of all, who's the sender here, and who's the recipient?

This text is still an utter mess.
The passage, "Bitwarden Secrets Manager is an end-to-end encrypted secrets management solution for securely storing, sharing, and deploying machine credentials like API keys, database passwords, and authentication certificates." and "To request a free trial for our team, please reach out to Bitwarden.", seem completely out of place, given the use of I form in this email, or whatever the medium may be.
Still waiting for this text to be rephrased to make logical sense…

trans-unit.source: view and select the members you want to give access to Secrets Manager.
trans-unit.target: och välj de medlemmar som du vill ge tillgång till Secrets Manager.

trans-unit.note: This is not possible to translate properly! Not all languages use this way of forming posession phrasing by adding 's to a word. Please change this to be a whole sentence with placeholders that are to be substituted with whatever the organisation owns.

It's not possible to translate this part of the sentence. The word sequence in Ukrainian is different. To resolve the issue, the original text should be changed to: "Open {something} of your organization to grant access to selected members.". In the current translation, I moved the translation from first part to the second part of the sentence, so the second part is too long and might be truncated.
Can anyone post what the rest of the sentence is?
Likewise, it can't be translated properly in Hebrew.
Please give us the full sentence

trans-unit.source: to grant access to selected members.
trans-unit.target: för att ge åtkomst till utvalda medlemmar.
trans-unit.note: Would it be possible to please make this a full sentence with placeholders? It's more difficult to translate like this, not knowing what this will be slapped at the end of.

Also, splitting sentences like this makes it hard or impossible to correctly use the necessary punctuation. For example, in Latvian comma must be used before this part of sentence. If it is added in translation here, as a result the comma will be rendered with a redundant space before it.

trans-unit.source: When member(s) are removed, they no longer have access to organization data and this action is irreversible. To add the member back to the organization, they must be invited and onboarded again. The process may take a few seconds to complete and cannot be interrupted or canceled.
trans-unit.target: När medlemmar tas bort har de inte längre tillgång till organisationsdata och åtgärden är oåterkallelig. För att lägga till medlemmen i organisationen igen måste denne bjudas in och onboardas på nytt. Processen kan ta några sekunder att slutföra och kan inte avbrytas eller avbrytas.
trans-unit.note:
@dwbit: Unnecessary switching between singular and plural forms for "members":
>> "When members are removed—an action that is irreversible—they can no longer access organization data. To add the members back to the organization, they must be invited and onboarded again. This process, which cannot be interrupted or cancelled, may take a few seconds to complete.".
Even though plural is used in this suggestion, it's quite evident that this procedure will also apply to singular instances (one user/member). Additionally, if we are to nitpick here, you can also say that the current wording "... To add the member back..." essentially is illogical, since that person, who has just been removed as a "member", is now merely "the person" or "the user", who's about to become a "member" again but isn't one yet. So, a more precise wording would be, e.g.:
"When users are removed as members—an action that is irreversible—they can no longer access organization data. To add the users back to the organization, they must be invited and onboarded again, a process that cannot be interrupted or canceled and may take a few seconds to complete.".
@NCAA Thanks!

trans-unit.note: @NCAA This is probably related to OpenID acr claims (as is string "expectedReturnAcrValue" too, I'm pretty sure). See: https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-eap-acr-values-1_0.html#acrValues ("ACR" = "Authentication Context Class Reference").
What "...Scopes..." are those specifically?

@NCAA I think "scopes" refers to: OpenID, profile, email address and phone. Can be more See a video about "An Introduction To OpenID Connect" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DxRTJN1Ffo&ab_channel=OracleLearning at 5m23s. Hope it helps! Also https://auth0.com/docs/configure/apis/scopes/openid-connect-scopes?
What does this mean? What is a 'claim type'?

@lyubomirv A claim is an individual piece of information such as: - name - family_name - given_name - middle_name - nickname - email - address - phone - gender - birthdate - gender - birthdate - profile - picture - website - zoneinfo - locale - updated_at
Scope(s) Are used to request that specific sets of information are made available as clean values such as: Mandatory - openid Standard - profile - email - address - phone
The client application request initially that claims and scopes to be returned to the ID Token
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DxRTJN1Ffo&ab_channel=OracleLearning
https://bitwarden.com/help/article/configure-sso-oidc/#oidc-attributes--claims
I'd say that "claim" should not be translated. In this context, technical people used to configure these integrations (SAML, SSO, etc) are used to this english vocabulary.
Is the "User ID" custom, or are the "claim types" custom?

@Crocmagnon I think while claims are individuals pieces of information, those can be personalized, not the user ID. "Define custom claim type keys for user identification (comma-delimited). When defined, custom claim types are searched for before falling back on standard types." https://bitwarden.com/help/configure-sso-oidc/#oidc-attributes--claims
@nicklcanada Thanks 👍🏻
Email claim is a claim that specify the email address as an entity https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.identitymodel.claims.claimtypes.email?view=netframework-4.8#definition
Custom scopes for requesting OpenID claims https://connect2id.com/products/server/docs/config/claims-mapping
A claim is a name value pair that represents what the subject is, not what the subject can do. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/security/authentication/claims

trans-unit.source: Select the organization you would like sponsored

trans-unit.note: Nothing about "sponsored organizations" on bitwarden.com as far as I can see. Searching for it renders no results...

@NCAA 1. Premium Access for Families Organization Plans https://bitwarden.com/blog/premium-access-families-organizations/ 2. Families Organizations https://bitwarden.com/help/article/about-bitwarden-plans/#families-organizations 3. Updates to Bitwarden Plans (2019-2020) https://bitwarden.com/help/article/2020-plan-updates/
The Classic 2019 Family Organization plan (prior to September 06, 2020 - you+4 members) changed to Families Organizations plan (you+5 members) that include Premium. You have to upgrade/change the plan (is not mandatory) or you can keep your old plan. If you upgrade to the new Families plan including Premium, for $40/year, you can select (sponsor) your old Classic Family Organization and grant premium access to all members of the organization.
@nicklcanada: Thanks a lot. :-)

Should it be read like "Select the organization you would like {TO sponsor}", then, the translation would be "Sélectionnez l'organisation que vous souhaiteriez parrainer". Like if it was written "Select the organization you would like to see sponsored" because, even if it looks very subtle, it still make a difference in French. trans-unit.note: A Sync Token is a pair of: email+ token. It connects your host with the cloud. Email is a name you give to the token Token is a serial. plusAddressedEmail
Username generator option that appends a random sub-address to the username. For example: address+subaddress@email.com

trans-unit.note: "Plus Addressing is a great way to quickly create custom (or disposable) email addresses based off your standard email address, by simply adding a "+" suffix string to an existing email address in Office 365. For example, a plus address for kimakers@contoso.com could be something like kimakers+northwind@contoso.com that she could use to sign up for the newsletter at the Northwind web site. Then when Northwind sends a newsletter to kimakers+northwind@contoso.com it will route directly to kimakers@contoso.com. Kim could create an Inbox rule that then moves messages sent to this + address into the "Northwind" folder. Plus addressing support in Office 365 is a great way to more easily manage your Inbox, and even track mail like marketing and sales campaigns." https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/exchange/support-for-plus-addressing-in-office-365/m-p/1170418
@nicklcanada Thanks! I was wondering what this was about. I added you comment to the glossary so it shows up for all platforms and is highlighted.

trans-unit.note: Which "part of a URL", specifically? What is the difference between "hostname" (String #11854) and "host" (String #2278)? Do both include the port number?
@grb Hey there! Hostname is the top level URL, where as host refers to the text including the port number.

trans-unit.source: Verification codes are sent to your email address when logging in from an unrecognized device

trans-unit.note: @NCAA Thanks, your feedback has been passed along to the team.

trans-unit.source: Are you sure you want to turn on device verification? The verification code emails will arrive at: $EMAIL$
trans-unit.target: Är du säker på att du vill aktivera enhetsverifiering? E-postmeddelandena med verifieringskoden kommer att anlända till: $EMAIL$

context-group.context:
areYouSureYouWantToEnableDeviceVerificationTheVerificationCodeEmailsWillArriveAtX
A sample value for the variable $email$: My Email

trans-unit.note: @NCAA Thanks, I've passed the feedback along to the team.
@NCAA Agreed -- In addition, it is possible that $EMAIL$ is an email forwarder, in which case it will never itself receive any emails.

@grb: Right. :-)
There are several good reasons for why "...you will receive...", "...it will arrive" and similar variants should not be used.
Basically, if you cannot guarantee beforehand that some specific event is going to happen/occur, then don't claim that it will.
Always keep Murphy's Law in mind! :-)

trans-unit.note: Context, please.
@CikiMomogi instead of disabled/enabled, on/off, let me know if that helps!
@NCAA 'Reporting' is a new tab in the web vault to manage Vault Health Reports and Event Logs.
@NCAA 👍
I presume that an avatar is the user icon of an account (currently consisting of letters) and is it used as anything more complicated than that?
@olavinto Yes, this is a new functionality that allows for picking a color. I''ve just created a new global glossary for use across all projects and I'll add this one to it.
Is "type" a verb or a noun?
I'd say it's a verb, as in "Type here to filter."
@NCAA Thanks all, this one is related to Secrets Manager Beta and filtering between different types of search results.
@NCAA Hey NCAA, I'm working back through older replies, sometimes I am replying directly from the notifications screen, which doesn't show the previous remarks, thanks for the feedback.
@NCAA Thanks for your patience all, this one is a verb. The secrets manager team has put in a pull request to add descriptions to all Secrets Manager strings, stay tuned!

@zoranb @maxcoder @NCAA As old as this thread is, I thought I'd specify that this appears in dropdown menus as the default selection (i.e. it is a placeholder before the user has selected any other menu item). It is not a text field to "type" text but a menu to select a "type" to filter by. It appear at least in organization management options under headers like "Select members", "Select groups", "Select collections", and possibly others. These also aren't basic simple dropdowns but instead they may be styled and support multiple selections.

trans-unit.note: For better respect of capital letters choice for "Secrets Manager" used as a proper name for an important feature, please review my translation: "Activer l'accès utilisateur au Gestionnaire de Secrets."

trans-unit.source: Activate user access to Secrets Manager.
trans-unit.note: @Inkoming I think it is required to translate "Secrets Manager" too with : "Gestionnaire de Secrets". Not doing so would go the opposite way as I believe was made in a lot the French translations until now. For example, "Vault" is translated and call "Coffre".

Hey! Secrets Manager is considered as a brand by Bitwarden. So we should use it this way. Moreover it’s perfectly clear and consistent through all the Bitwarden’s projects (and localizations). In France, the huge companies like Google or AWS are using this term this way too, so the developers are pretty familiar with it (it’s a very common term in cyber/tech).
Thanks for your message!
@Inkoming Ok. It's not always easy to know what to do!

trans-unit.source: This user can access Secrets Manager
trans-unit.target: Denna användare har åtkomst till Secrets Manager
trans-unit.note: For better respect of capital letters choice for "Secrets Manager" used as a proper name for an important feature, please review my translation: "Activer l'accès utilisateur au Gestionnaire de Secrets."
@HeartCore The source string has no period at the end

@kennymc-c that's correct, but the general punctuation rule of the German language says that they should be added after each simple or compound sentence. Therefore it should be added to the German translation if it is not part of a larger sentence, button, title, link or checkbox.

@HeartCore But this rule also applies in English grammar. There are a lot of other strings with simple sentences that also don't have punctuation at the end. I am not sure if this is really an issue in the source string, they are added afterwards or it has other reasons.

trans-unit.note:
The currently approved translation is not correct, please review my translation : "La suppression de $USER$ sans leur définir un mot de passe principal, peut restreindre l'accès à leur compte dans son intégralité. Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir continuer?"@Inkoming
Wrong word : "soin" instead of "son" if let in singular form but plural should be used here so I made the while translation plural.

@dwbit: Since English has a weakness when it comes to the construction of texts like this one, what would then be the accurate interpretation here (I'm guessing singular, but…):
"Removing $USER$ without setting a master password for that user may restrict full account access. Continue anyway?" / "Removing $USER$ without setting a master password for those users may restrict full account access. Continue anyway?".

@NCAA While I also agree and was about to translate this (and the one about members) much like this, until I thought that they may have wanted to highlight that these affect the users (or members) personal accounts instead of the organization accounts that their personal accounts have been connected to (hence the use of "their full account", although I'm not sure what is the "less full" account that you could access otherwise...). With that being said, an organization admin should probably be aware of this...

@JSeb "Soin" instead of "Son" typing error fixed.
About "them / their", it looks like, in this case, we're within the gender neutrality (third-person pronouns) topic.
I'm keeping all the logs of these source strings on a separate specific sheet I'll share to parse them as soon as all the other French consistency topics are solved.
Thanks again for all the help with French.

trans-unit.source: Removing members who do not have master passwords without setting one for them may restrict access to their full account.

If someone is already a member, there is no point in inviting them:
>> "Upgrade your plan to invite people to become members and experience powerful security features." / "Upgrade your plan to invite people to join and experience powerful security features.".
@NCAA I agree. Could be "users" instead of people though. Because a person needs an account to be a member and one person can have multiple user accounts.
@olavinto: Agreed, I often suggest both flavors, but I guess I was a bit lazy in this case (or was in a hurry). :-)

trans-unit.source: Payment with a bank account is only available to customers in the United States. You will be required to verify your bank account. We will make a micro-deposit within the next 1-2 business days. Enter the statement descriptor code from this deposit on the organization's billing page to verify the bank account. Failure to verify the bank account will result in a missed payment and your subscription being suspended.
trans-unit.target: Betalning med bankkonto är endast tillgänglig för kunder i USA. Du kommer att bli ombedd att verifiera ditt bankkonto. Vi kommer att göra en mikroinsättning inom de närmaste 1-2 bankdagarna. Ange koden för kontoutdraget från den här insättningen på organisationens faktureringssida för att verifiera bankkontot. Om du inte verifierar bankkontot kommer det att resultera i en missad betalning och din prenumeration kommer att stängas av.

trans-unit.source: We have made a micro-deposit to your bank account (this may take 1-2 business days). Enter the six-digit code starting with 'SM' found on the deposit description. Failure to verify the bank account will result in a missed payment and your subscription being suspended.
trans-unit.target: Vi har gjort en mikroinsättning till ditt bankkonto (detta kan ta 1-2 bankdagar). Ange den sexsiffriga koden som börjar med "SM" som finns i beskrivningen av insättningen. Om du inte verifierar bankkontot kommer det att leda till en missad betalning och att din prenumeration stängs av.

Om domänen inte kan göras anspråk på, kontrollera DNS-posten i din host och gör anspråk manuellt. Domänen kommer att tas bort från din organisation inom 7 dagar om den inte görs anspråk på.

trans-unit.source: This organization has an Enterprise policy that will enroll you in account recovery. Enrollment will allow organization administrators to change your password. Only proceed if you recognize this organization and the fingerprint phrase displayed below matches the organization's fingerprint.
trans-unit.target: Den här organisationen har en företagspolicy som gör att du kan registrera dig till kontoåterställning. Registreringen gör det möjligt för organisationens administratörer att ändra ditt lösenord. Fortsätt bara om du känner igen den här organisationen och om fingeravtrycksfrasen som visas nedan matchar organisationens fingeravtryck.

trans-unit.note: Is it really neccessary to break sentences like this? Why cannot variables be used in such cases? In some languages the word ordering in translated text may be quite different, thus making translation of such broken sentences more complicated. For example, in Latvian the best location for the translation of "from the toolbar" would be at the beginning of the sentence (while it is acceptable to leave it at the end, but that feels a bit awkward). While I can move the translation of "from the toolbar" to the first part leaving only period in this part, it most probably will result in a awkward space before the period.

trans-unit.source: With the Bitwarden browser extension you can easily create new logins, access your saved logins directly from your browser toolbar, and sign in to accounts quickly using Bitwarden autofill.
trans-unit.target: Med webbläsartillägget Bitwarden kan du enkelt skapa nya inloggningar, komma åt dina sparade inloggningar direkt från webbläsarens verktygsfält och logga in på konton snabbt med hjälp av Bitwardens autofyll.

trans-unit.source: Payment with a bank account is only available to customers in the United States. You will be required to verify your bank account. We will make a micro-deposit within the next 1-2 business days. Enter the statement descriptor code from this deposit on the provider's subscription page to verify the bank account. Failure to verify the bank account will result in a missed payment and your subscription being suspended.
trans-unit.target: Betalning med bankkonto är endast tillgänglig för kunder i USA. Du kommer att bli ombedd att verifiera ditt bankkonto. Vi kommer att göra en mikroinsättning inom de närmaste 1-2 bankdagarna. Ange koden för kontoutdrag från den här insättningen på leverantörens prenumerationssida för att verifiera bankkontot. Om du inte verifierar bankkontot kommer det att leda till en missad betalning och att din prenumeration stängs av.

trans-unit.source: Please click the Pay with PayPal button to add your payment method.
trans-unit.target: Klicka på knappen Betala med PayPal för att lägga till din betalningsmetod.

trans-unit.source: If you remove $EMAIL$, the sponsorship for this Family plan will end. A seat within your organization will become available for members or sponsorships after the sponsored organization renewal date on $DATE$.
trans-unit.target: Om du tar bort $EMAIL$ upphör sponsringen för den här familjeplanen. En plats inom din organisation kommer att bli tillgänglig för medlemmar eller sponsring efter förnyelsedatumet för den sponsrade organisationen på $DATE$.

trans-unit.source: Payment with a bank account is only available to customers in the United States. You will be required to verify your bank account. We will make a micro-deposit within the next 1-2 business days. Enter the statement descriptor code from this deposit on the Payment Details page to verify the bank account. Failure to verify the bank account will result in a missed payment and your subscription being suspended.
trans-unit.target: Betalning med bankkonto är endast tillgänglig för kunder i USA. Du kommer att bli ombedd att verifiera ditt bankkonto. Vi kommer att göra en mikroinsättning inom de närmaste 1-2 bankdagarna. Ange koden för kontoutdraget från den här insättningen på sidan Betalningsinformation för att verifiera bankkontot. Om du inte verifierar bankkontot kommer det att resultera i en missad betalning och din prenumeration kommer att stängas av.
